text: Ion Mihai Pacepa (; 28 October 1928 – 14 February 2021) was a Romanian two- star general in the Securitate. He worked for the secret police of Communist Romania. He defected to the United States in July 1978 following President Jimmy Carter's approval of his political asylum. He was an advisor to President Nicolae Ceauşescu. He worked with the American Central Intelligence Agency (CIA)."Red past in Romania's present", by Arnaud de Borchgrave, The Washington Times, 14 January 2004 Pacepa died on 14 February 2021 of COVID-19 in New Jersey, aged 92. ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in New Jersey Category:Romanian generals Category:People from Bucharest Category:Spies
